title: If one of your team mates rage quits save everyone some frusteration and just fucking surrender.
body:
Title. Just lost a 4v5 cause our Kai'sa rage quitted after losing botlane.

PSA: **NOBODY** wants to fucking play a 4v5 especially the team with the missing teammate.

replies.body:
What's really awesome is about 2/3 of the time the other team decides at that point to become trolls and try to drag out the game as long as possible. Now you're held hostage by both sides.

And, of course, the popular opinion is if you just allow a push at that point **YOU** are the one at fault.
I think most of us have won 4v5's, but I would much rather ff and take the loss than to deal with the stress of a 4v5 game
Don't you dare call the guy saying no to surrender an asshole tho. that would make you the toxic one in all this of course !

True.
Yeahhh, SOMETIMES you can STILL win yadda yadda yadda; who cares?
The odds are SUPER low (and the higher the rank the lower the chance) and LoL is supposed to be a game anyway, something to have fun with: and a 4vs5 is all but fun, that slime chance is simply not worth it.

What if you have an Akali, Jax, Camille, Irelia, Lucian, Pyke, etc etc etc. 
On your team?
Theres still a really good chance youll win considering those champions have more impact than most two champions combined.

that's the point. There are only 2 ways to win a 4v5 if your Rage Quitter stayed gone and the game is even-ish. And that is the enemy team decided they wanted to pat their score with CS and Kills thus allowing your team if they have late game winners to get to that stage. The second is if they become stupid and decide to troll thinking they win easily. Case and point that one YT video of a Rammus and Nunu running it down mid giving the enemy a total of 80 kills combined in deaths and the enemy team still loses for playing Aram.

Yeah I agree. The only time I wouldn't is when you have a really fed and competent carry. Most of the time ff is the right play.

If they ragequit AFTER losing lane, then yes.
If they tilted and left over some bullshit before the match even started, then thank your lucky stars that loser isn't on your team and play.

Let me tell you a story:
Jhin/Ori load into a match vs Vayne/Zyra. Jhin disconnects unexpectedly before he even reaches the lane. Never comes back.
So i'm over here under tower with my Coin, doing a shit job of last hitting because I one trick support, just trying to not feed for long enough for my ADC to come back. Vayne tries to towerdive me alone level 3 to my level 2, dies to tower and neeaaaarly kills me.
Now this is before turret plating, and before tower damage was changed such that mages can hurt them more. So they get nothing from me being forced to back. I keep on last hitting under tower and Zyra and Vayne both try to dive me before any of us have hit 6. They manage to kill me, but both die.
Then my jungler shows up and we pull off a double, giving no kills.
Zyra ragequits.
We win the now 4v4 match.

Turns out losing a 2v1 lane sometimes causes tilt. Tilt that straight up lost them the game because their now solo Vayne was actually behind me in level, due to having to share exp.
Would it work in today's meta? Probably not with supports taking {{summoner:14}} and even a little tower damage yielding gold. It probably wouldn't even have worked if they picked different champions or juggled aggro better. But I honestly wasn't expecting it to work in the first place. You never know until you try I guess.

At the very least, you should try until 15 so that feeding doesn't effect your stats too much. Assuming you don't get to just remake and play a normal match instead.

Someone once won a 4v5 against me (I was the 5 team). If your team comp is bad enough and theirs is good enough it won't be that bad. Especially since ADC's are pretty much out-shined by their support Brands and Zyras in both utility and damage. If your adc afks, it's not that big of a deal. Worst afks are jungle, because a good jungler can abuse the hell out of that, and mid lane, because now the enemy mid lane can just shove to turret and roam 24/7. Otherwise I think the games are still winnable with how big of skill gaps and "try" gaps can be in games. If you're in a 4v5, the 5 team probably isn't as focused now, they probably think it's a free win. Abuse that. Also let's be real, sometimes someone on the enemy team decides to join your team by just feeding you kills non-stop and tilting off the face of the planet. Would rather have an afk on my team than one of those.

Imagine though Early Surrender expecting vote from the CD'd guy.
Because that happened to me once.
Was fun.
"Luckily", another guy said NO so it wouldn't pass anyway but was bullshit nontheless.

I just had an ezreal keep me hostage in a game. our yorick rage quit because he lost to a poppy. (Which i understand {{champion:78}} is beyond broken , rito plz). And our ezreal kept voting no. Even though he kept dying he kept saying "im having fun , so you stay here with me and have fun summoner!". The worst part is , that he was in a duo so we couldnt even ff at 20. We had to wait for them to run down our base. I wish we could report idiots like him too.
4vs5 in nexus blits, score is 24-3, team refuses to surrender, how do you expect me to stay sane
